023package squidpony.squidmath;
024
025import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
026
027import java.io.Serializable;
028import java.util.ArrayList;
029import java.util.Collection;
030import java.util.Comparator;
031import java.util.ListIterator;
032
033/**
034 * A Java implementation of an incremental 2D Delaunay triangulation algorithm.
035 * This is a port of <a href="https://github.com/jdiemke/delaunay-triangulator">Johannes Diemke's code</a>, with
036 * some substantial non-algorithmic changes to better work in SquidLib and to reduce allocations. You should consider
037 * using the {@code com.badlogic.gdx.math.DelaunayTriangulator} class if you use libGDX, which allocates fewer objects.
038 * @author Johannes Diemke
039 * @author Tommy Ettinger
040 */
041@Beta
042public class Delaunay3D implements Serializable {
043    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
044
045    public static final class MultiCoord
046    {
047        public double x, y, z;
048        public CoordDouble flat;
049        public MultiCoord()
050        {
051            x = y = z = 0.0;
052            flat = new CoordDouble();
053        }
054        public MultiCoord(CoordDouble flatCoord)
055        {
056            x = y = z = Double.NaN;
057            flat = flatCoord;
058        }
059        public MultiCoord(final double x, final double y, final double z)
060        {
061            this.x = x;
062            this.y = y;
063            this.z = z;
064            flat = new CoordDouble(x / (1.0 - z), y / (1.0 - z));
065        }
066    }
067    private MultiCoord[] points;
068    private ArrayList<Triangle> triangleSoup;
069
070    /**
071     * Constructs a triangulator instance but does not insert any points; you should add points to
072     * {@link #getPoints()}, which is an array that can hold 256 points, before running {@link #triangulate()}.
073     */
074    public Delaunay3D() {
075        this.points = new MultiCoord[256];
076        this.triangleSoup = new ArrayList<>(256);
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Constructs a new triangulator instance using the specified point set.
081     *
082     * @param points The point set to be triangulated
083     */
084    public Delaunay3D(Collection<MultiCoord> points) {
085        this.points = points.toArray(new MultiCoord[points.size()]);
086        this.triangleSoup = new ArrayList<>(points.size());
087    }
088
089    /**
090     * Constructs a new triangulator instance using the specified point set.
091     *
092     * @param triples The point set to be triangulated, as groups of 3 doubles for x,y,z
093     */
094    public Delaunay3D(double[] triples) {
095        this.points = new MultiCoord[triples.length / 3];
096        for (int i = 2, j = 0; i < triples.length; i += 3, j++) {
097            points[j] = new MultiCoord(triples[i-2], triples[i-1], triples[i]);
098        }
099        this.triangleSoup = new ArrayList<>(this.points.length);
100    }
101    /**
102     * Returns the triangle from this triangle soup that contains the specified
103     * point or null if no triangle from the triangle soup contains the point.
104     *
105     * @param point
106     *            The point
107     * @return Returns the triangle from this triangle soup that contains the
108     *         specified point or null
109     */
110    public Triangle findContainingTriangle(CoordDouble point) {
111        for (Triangle triangle : triangleSoup) {
112            if (triangle.contains(point)) {
113                return triangle;
114            }
115        }
116        return null;
117    }
118    /**
119     * Returns the neighbor triangle of the specified triangle sharing the same
120     * edge as specified. If no neighbor sharing the same edge exists null is
121     * returned.
122     *
123     * @param triangle
124     *            The triangle
125     * @param edge
126     *            The edge
127     * @return The triangles neighbor triangle sharing the same edge or null if
128     *         no triangle exists
129     */
130    public Triangle findNeighbor(Triangle triangle, Edge edge) {
131        for (Triangle triangleFromSoup : triangleSoup) {
132            if (triangleFromSoup.isNeighbor(edge) && triangleFromSoup != triangle) {
133                return triangleFromSoup;
134            }
135        }
136        return null;
137    }
138    public Triangle findNeighbor(Triangle triangle, MultiCoord ea, MultiCoord eb) {
139        for (Triangle triangleFromSoup : triangleSoup) {
140            if (triangleFromSoup.isNeighbor(ea, eb) && triangleFromSoup != triangle) {
141                return triangleFromSoup;
142            }
143        }
144        return null;
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * Returns one of the possible triangles sharing the specified edge. Based
149     * on the ordering of the triangles in this triangle soup the returned
150     * triangle may differ. To find the other triangle that shares this edge use
151     * the {@link #findNeighbor(Triangle, Edge)} method.
152     *
153     * @param edge
154     *            The edge
155     * @return Returns one triangle that shares the specified edge
156     */
157    public Triangle findOneTriangleSharing(Edge edge) {
158        for (Triangle triangle : triangleSoup) {
159            if (triangle.isNeighbor(edge)) {
160                return triangle;
161            }
162        }
163        return null;
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Returns the edge from the triangle soup nearest to the specified point.
168     *
169     * @param point
170     *            The point
171     * @return The edge from the triangle soup nearest to the specified point
172     */
173    public Edge findNearestEdge(CoordDouble point) {
174//            List<EdgeDistancePack> edgeList = new ArrayList<EdgeDistancePack>();
175
176        OrderedMap<Edge, Double> edges = new OrderedMap<>(triangleSoup.size());
177        for (Triangle triangle : triangleSoup) {
178            Edge ab = new Edge(triangle.a, triangle.b);
179            Edge bc = new Edge(triangle.b, triangle.c);
180            Edge ca = new Edge(triangle.c, triangle.a);
181            double abd = triangle.computeClosestPoint(ab, point).subtract(point).lengthSq();
182            double bcd = triangle.computeClosestPoint(bc, point).subtract(point).lengthSq();
183            double cad = triangle.computeClosestPoint(ca, point).subtract(point).lengthSq();
184
185            if(abd <= bcd && abd <= cad)
186                edges.put(ab, abd);
187            else if(bcd <= abd && bcd <= cad)
188                edges.put(bc, bcd);
189            else
190                edges.put(ca, cad);
191        }
192        edges.sortByValue(doubleComparator);
193        return edges.keyAt(0);
194    }
195
196    /**
197     * Removes all triangles from this triangle soup that contain the specified
198     * vertex.
199     *
200     * @param vertex
201     *            The vertex
202     */
203    public void removeTrianglesUsing(MultiCoord vertex) {
204        ListIterator<Triangle> li = triangleSoup.listIterator();
205        while (li.hasNext())
206        {
207            Triangle triangle = li.next();
208            if(triangle.hasVertex(vertex))
209                li.remove();
210        }
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * This method generates a Delaunay triangulation from the specified point
215     * set.
216     */
217    public ArrayList<Triangle> triangulate() {
218        int numPoints;
219        if (points == null || (numPoints = points.length) < 3) {
220            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Less than three points in point set.");
221        }
222        triangleSoup.clear();
223
224        /*
225         * In order for the in circumcircle test to not consider the vertices of
226         * the super triangle we have to start out with a big triangle
227         * containing the whole point set. We have to scale the super triangle
228         * to be very large. Otherwise the triangulation is not convex.
229         */
230        double maxOfAnyCoordinate = 0.0;
231
232        for (int i = 0; i < numPoints; i++) {
233            final CoordDouble pt = points[i].flat;
234            maxOfAnyCoordinate = Math.max(Math.max(pt.x, pt.y), maxOfAnyCoordinate);
235        }
236
237        maxOfAnyCoordinate *= 48.0;
238
239        CoordDouble p1 = new CoordDouble(0.0, maxOfAnyCoordinate);
240        CoordDouble p2 = new CoordDouble(maxOfAnyCoordinate, 0.0);
241        CoordDouble p3 = new CoordDouble(-maxOfAnyCoordinate, -maxOfAnyCoordinate);
242
243        Triangle superTriangle = new Triangle(p1, p2, p3);
244
245        triangleSoup.add(superTriangle);
246
247        for (int i = 0; i < points.length; i++) {
248            Triangle triangle = findContainingTriangle(points[i].flat);
249
250            if (triangle == null) {
251                /*
252                  If no containing triangle exists, then the vertex is not
253                  inside a triangle (this can also happen due to numerical
254                  errors) and lies on an edge. In order to find this edge we
255                  search all edges of the triangle soup and select the one
256                  which is nearest to the point we try to add. This edge is
257                  removed and four new edges are added.
258                 */
259                Edge edge = findNearestEdge(points[i].flat);
260
261                Triangle first = findOneTriangleSharing(edge);
262                Triangle second = findNeighbor(first, edge);
263
264                MultiCoord firstNonEdgeVertex = first.getNonEdgeVertex(edge);
265                MultiCoord secondNonEdgeVertex = second.getNonEdgeVertex(edge);
266                MultiCoord p = points[i];
267                
268                triangleSoup.remove(first);
269                triangleSoup.remove(second);
270
271                Triangle triangle1 = new Triangle(edge.a, firstNonEdgeVertex,  p);
272                Triangle triangle2 = new Triangle(edge.b, firstNonEdgeVertex,  p);
273                Triangle triangle3 = new Triangle(edge.a, secondNonEdgeVertex, p);
274                Triangle triangle4 = new Triangle(edge.b, secondNonEdgeVertex, p);
275
276                triangleSoup.add(triangle1);
277                triangleSoup.add(triangle2);
278                triangleSoup.add(triangle3);
279                triangleSoup.add(triangle4);
280
281                legalizeEdge(triangle1, edge.a, firstNonEdgeVertex,  p);
282                legalizeEdge(triangle2, edge.b, firstNonEdgeVertex,  p);
283                legalizeEdge(triangle3, edge.a, secondNonEdgeVertex, p);
284                legalizeEdge(triangle4, edge.b, secondNonEdgeVertex, p);
285            } else {
286                /*
287                 * The vertex is inside a triangle.
288                 */
289                MultiCoord a = triangle.a;
290                MultiCoord b = triangle.b;
291                MultiCoord c = triangle.c;
292                MultiCoord p = points[i];
293                
294                triangleSoup.remove(triangle);
295
296                Triangle first = new Triangle(a, b, p);
297                Triangle second = new Triangle(b, c, p);
298                Triangle third = new Triangle(c, a, p);
299
300                triangleSoup.add(first);
301                triangleSoup.add(second);
302                triangleSoup.add(third);
303
304                legalizeEdge(first,  a, b, p);
305                legalizeEdge(second, b, c, p);
306                legalizeEdge(third,  c, a, p);
307            }
308        }
309
310        /*
311         * Remove all triangles that contain vertices of the super triangle.
312         */
313        removeTrianglesUsing(superTriangle.a);
314        removeTrianglesUsing(superTriangle.b);
315        removeTrianglesUsing(superTriangle.c);
316        return triangleSoup;
317    }
318
319    /**
320     * This method legalizes edges by recursively flipping all illegal edges.
321     * 
322     * @param triangle
323     *            The triangle
324     * @param ea
325     *            The "a" point on the edge to be legalized
326     * @param eb
327     *            The "b" point on the edge to be legalized
328     * @param newVertex
329     *            The new vertex
330     */
331    private void legalizeEdge(Triangle triangle, MultiCoord ea, MultiCoord eb, MultiCoord newVertex) {
332        Triangle neighborTriangle = findNeighbor(triangle, ea, eb);
333
334        /*
335          If the triangle has a neighbor, then legalize the edge
336         */
337        if (neighborTriangle != null) {
338            if (neighborTriangle.isPointInCircumcircle(newVertex.flat)) {
339                triangleSoup.remove(triangle);
340                triangleSoup.remove(neighborTriangle);
341
342                MultiCoord noneEdgeVertex = neighborTriangle.getNonEdgeVertex(ea, eb);
343
344                Triangle firstTriangle = new Triangle(noneEdgeVertex, ea, newVertex);
345                Triangle secondTriangle = new Triangle(noneEdgeVertex, eb, newVertex);
346
347                triangleSoup.add(firstTriangle);
348                triangleSoup.add(secondTriangle);
349
350                legalizeEdge(firstTriangle, noneEdgeVertex, ea, newVertex);
351                legalizeEdge(secondTriangle, noneEdgeVertex, eb, newVertex);
352            }
353        }
354    }
355
356    /**
357     * Creates a random permutation of the specified point set. Based on the
358     * implementation of the Delaunay algorithm this can speed up the
359     * computation.
360     */
361    public void shuffle(IRNG rng) {
362        rng.shuffleInPlace(points);
363    }
364    
365    /**
366     * Returns the point set in form of a vector of 2D vectors.
367     * 
368     * @return Returns the points set.
369     */
370    public MultiCoord[] getPoints() {
371        return points;
372    }
373
374    /**
375     * Returns the triangles of the triangulation in form of a list of 2D
376     * triangles.
377     * 
378     * @return Returns the triangles of the triangulation.
379     */
380    public ArrayList<Triangle> getTriangles() {
381        return triangleSoup;
382    }
383    
384    public static class Edge implements Serializable
385    {
386        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
387        
388        public MultiCoord a;
389        public MultiCoord b;
390        
391        public Edge()
392        {
393            a = new MultiCoord();
394            b = new MultiCoord();
395        }
396        public Edge(MultiCoord a, MultiCoord b)
397        {
398            this.a = a;
399            this.b = b;
400        }
401        public Edge(double ax, double ay, double bx, double by)
402        {
403            a = new MultiCoord(new CoordDouble(ax, ay));
404            b = new MultiCoord(new CoordDouble(bx, by));
405        }
406    }
407    
408    public static class Triangle implements Serializable
409    {
410        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
411
412        public MultiCoord a;
413        public MultiCoord b;
414        public MultiCoord c;
415
416        /**
417         * Constructor of the 2D triangle class used to create a new triangle
418         * instance from three 2D vectors describing the triangle's vertices.
419         *
420         * @param a
421         *            The first vertex of the triangle
422         * @param b
423         *            The second vertex of the triangle
424         * @param c
425         *            The third vertex of the triangle
426         */
427        public Triangle(MultiCoord a, MultiCoord b, MultiCoord c) {
428            this.a = a;
429            this.b = b;
430            this.c = c;
431        }
432
433        /**
434         * Constructor of the 2D triangle class used to create a new triangle
435         * instance from three 2D vectors describing the triangle's vertices.
436         *
437         * @param a
438         *            The first vertex of the triangle
439         * @param b
440         *            The second vertex of the triangle
441         * @param c
442         *            The third vertex of the triangle
443         */
444        public Triangle(CoordDouble a, CoordDouble b, CoordDouble c) {
445            this.a = new MultiCoord(a);
446            this.b = new MultiCoord(b);
447            this.c = new MultiCoord(c);
448        }
449
450        /**
451         * Tests if a 2D point lies inside this 2D triangle. See Real-Time Collision
452         * Detection, chap. 5, p. 206.
453         *
454         * @param point
455         *            The point to be tested
456         * @return Returns true iff the point lies inside this 2D triangle
457         */
458        public boolean contains(CoordDouble point) {
459            double px = point.x - a.x;
460            double py = point.y - a.y;
461            double sx = b.x - a.x;
462            double sy = b.y - a.y;
463            double pab = py * sx - px * sy;//point.sub(a).cross(b.sub(a));
464            px = point.x - b.x;
465            py = point.y - b.y;
466            sx = c.x - b.x;
467            sy = c.y - b.y;
468            double pbc = py * sx - px * sy;//point.sub(b).cross(c.sub(b));
469
470            if (!hasSameSign(pab, pbc)) {
471                return false;
472            }
473
474            px = point.x - c.x;
475            py = point.y - c.y;
476            sx = a.x - c.x;
477            sy = a.y - c.y;
478            double pca = py * sx - px * sy;//point.sub(c).cross(a.sub(c));
479
480            return hasSameSign(pab, pca);
481
482        }
483
484        /**
485         * Tests if a given point lies in the circumcircle of this triangle. Let the
486         * triangle ABC appear in counterclockwise (CCW) order. Then when det &gt;
487         * 0, the point lies inside the circumcircle through the three points a, b
488         * and c. If instead det &lt; 0, the point lies outside the circumcircle.
489         * When det = 0, the four points are cocircular. If the triangle is oriented
490         * clockwise (CW) the result is reversed. See Real-Time Collision Detection,
491         * chap. 3, p. 34.
492         *
493         * @param point
494         *            The point to be tested
495         * @return Returns true iff the point lies inside the circumcircle through
496         *         the three points a, b, and c of the triangle
497         */
498        public boolean isPointInCircumcircle(CoordDouble point) {
499            double a11 = a.x - point.x;
500            double a21 = b.x - point.x;
501            double a31 = c.x - point.x;
502
503            double a12 = a.y - point.y;
504            double a22 = b.y - point.y;
505            double a32 = c.y - point.y;
506
507            double a13 = (a.x - point.x) * (a.x - point.x) + (a.y - point.y) * (a.y - point.y);
508            double a23 = (b.x - point.x) * (b.x - point.x) + (b.y - point.y) * (b.y - point.y);
509            double a33 = (c.x - point.x) * (c.x - point.x) + (c.y - point.y) * (c.y - point.y);
510
511            double det = a11 * a22 * a33 + a12 * a23 * a31 + a13 * a21 * a32 - a13 * a22 * a31 - a12 * a21 * a33
512                    - a11 * a23 * a32;
513
514            if (isOrientedCCW()) {
515                return det > 0.0;
516            }
517
518            return det < 0.0;
519        }
520
521        /**
522         * Test if this triangle is oriented counterclockwise (CCW). Let A, B and C
523         * be three 2D points. If det &gt; 0, C lies to the left of the directed
524         * line AB. Equivalently the triangle ABC is oriented counterclockwise. When
525         * det &lt; 0, C lies to the right of the directed line AB, and the triangle
526         * ABC is oriented clockwise. When det = 0, the three points are colinear.
527         * See Real-Time Collision Detection, chap. 3, p. 32
528         *
529         * @return Returns true iff the triangle ABC is oriented counterclockwise
530         *         (CCW)
531         */
532        public boolean isOrientedCCW() {
533            double a11 = a.x - c.x;
534            double a21 = b.x - c.x;
535
536            double a12 = a.y - c.y;
537            double a22 = b.y - c.y;
538
539            double det = a11 * a22 - a12 * a21;
540
541            return det > 0.0;
542        }
543
544        /**
545         * Returns true if this triangle contains the given edge.
546         *
547         * @param edge
548         *            The edge to be tested
549         * @return Returns true if this triangle contains the edge
550         */
551        public boolean isNeighbor(Edge edge) {
552            return (a == edge.a || b == edge.a || c == edge.a) && (a == edge.b || b == edge.b || c == edge.b);
553        }
554        public boolean isNeighbor(MultiCoord ea, MultiCoord eb) {
555            return (a == ea || b == ea || c == ea) && (a == eb || b == eb || c == eb);
556        }
557        public boolean isNeighbor(CoordDouble ea, CoordDouble eb) {
558            return (a.flat == ea || b.flat == ea || c.flat == ea) && (a.flat == eb || b.flat == eb || c.flat == eb);
559        }
560
561        /**
562         * Returns the vertex of this triangle that is not part of the given edge.
563         *
564         * @param edge
565         *            The edge
566         * @return The vertex of this triangle that is not part of the edge
567         */
568        public MultiCoord getNonEdgeVertex(Edge edge) {
569            if (a != edge.a && a != edge.b) {
570                return a;
571            } else if (b != edge.a && b != edge.b) {
572                return b;
573            } else if (c != edge.a && c != edge.b) {
574                return c;
575            }
576
577            return null;
578        }
579        public MultiCoord getNonEdgeVertex(MultiCoord ea, MultiCoord eb) {
580            if (a != ea && a != eb) {
581                return a;
582            } else if (b != ea && b != eb) {
583                return b;
584            } else if (c != ea && c != eb) {
585                return c;
586            }
587
588            return null;
589        }
590
591        /**
592         * Returns true if the given vertex is one of the vertices describing this
593         * triangle.
594         *
595         * @param vertex
596         *            The vertex to be tested
597         * @return Returns true if the Vertex is one of the vertices describing this
598         *         triangle
599         */
600        public boolean hasVertex(MultiCoord vertex) {
601            if (a == vertex || b == vertex || c == vertex) {
602                return true;
603            }
604            return false;
605        }
606
607        /**
608         * Returns true if the given vertex is one of the vertices describing this
609         * triangle.
610         *
611         * @param vertex
612         *            The vertex to be tested
613         * @return Returns true if the Vertex is one of the vertices describing this
614         *         triangle
615         */
616        public boolean hasVertex(CoordDouble vertex) {
617            if (a.flat == vertex || b.flat == vertex || c.flat == vertex) {
618                return true;
619            }
620            return false;
621        }
622
623        /**
624         * Computes the closest point on the given edge to the specified point.
625         *
626         * @param edge
627         *            The edge on which we search the closest point to the specified
628         *            point
629         * @param point
630         *            The point to which we search the closest point on the edge
631         * @return The closest point on the given edge to the specified point
632         */
633        CoordDouble computeClosestPoint(Edge edge, CoordDouble point) {
634            double abx = edge.b.x = edge.a.x;
635            double aby = edge.b.y = edge.a.y;
636            double t = ((point.x - edge.a.x) * abx + (point.y - edge.a.y) * aby) / (abx * abx + aby * aby);
637
638            if (t < 0.0d) {
639                t = 0.0d;
640            } else if (t > 1.0d) {
641                t = 1.0d;
642            }
643            return new CoordDouble(edge.a.x + abx * t, edge.a.y + aby * t);
644        }
645
646        /**
647         * Tests if the two arguments have the same sign.
648         *
649         * @param a
650         *            The first double argument
651         * @param b
652         *            The second double argument
653         * @return Returns true iff both arguments have the same sign
654         */
655        private boolean hasSameSign(double a, double b) {
656            return (a == 0.0 && b == 0.0) || ((a > 0.0) == (b > 0.0));
657        }
658
659        @Override
660        public String toString() {
661            return "Triangle[" + a + ", " + b + ", " + c + "]";
662        }
663    }
664    private static final Comparator<Double> doubleComparator = new Comparator<Double>() {
665        @Override
666        public int compare(Double o1, Double o2) {
667            return o1.compareTo(o2);
668        }
669    };
670}
